problem_text:
We define the length l(g) of an Engel element g of a group G to be the
smallest number l such that [h, g; l] = 1 for all h ∈G. Here [h, g; 1] = [h, g] and
[h, g; i + 1] = [[h, g; i], g]. Does there exist a polynomial function φ(x, y) such that
l(uv) ⩽φ(l(u), l(v))? Up to now, it is unknown whether a product of Engel elements
is again an Engel element.
V. A. Roman’kov
answer: No, it does not (L. V. Dolbak, Siberian Math. J., 47, no. 1 (2006), 55–57).
